availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky, farmer, soldier. Virginia native. Farmer in Kentucky in 1864. Served as a private in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Capital Guards (U.S.A.) from May 10, 1864 to desertion on September 12, 1864. Served as a private in the 39th Kentucky Infantry from April 1865 to September 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 774.
Find A Grave, "Guy H. Bandy (1842-1925)," Memorial #93463993, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93463993 (accessed January 21, 2020).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 421.
